result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:44 PM Defendant Michael A Holtger not in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Michael A Holtger.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  

Defense advises that she does not know why the Defendant does not appear today. 

Court notes that competency evaluation was not completed  as they were unable to locate the Defendant following his release from the Marinette County Jail. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. State requests a Br. 4 only capias. Court orders same.

Br. 4 only.

1:44 PM Attorney Angela Wang in court for Michael A Holtger. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense advises that the Defendant is in custody at the Marinette County Jail.  Defense requests a competency evaluation and gives details as to a factual basis for this request. Defendant is serving a sanction in Marinette County jail until 09/15/2022.

Court will order Order for Competency Evaluation and will order that at an in-patient basis. Court will set a review hearing.
Review hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:43 AM Defendant Michael A Holtger in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Randy Sitzberger sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Thompson.  Cross examination by Atty. Wang.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Thompson moves for bind over.  Atty. Wang takes no position.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
